creditline: Gift of Alastair B. Martin, Class of 1938

makers.displaymaker: Circle of Wolf Huber, German, ca. 1485–1553
formerly attributed to Hans Dürer, German, 1490–ca. 1538

texts.textentryhtml: Richard von Kaufmann, Berlin (by 1893-1917; sale, Paul Cassirer and Hugo Helbing, Berlin, December 4-5, 1917, lot 144, to Bondy); Oskar Bondy, Vienna [d. 1944] (1917-1938; seized by the Nazis, 1938, and held at Alt Aussee; collected by the Allies and taken to the Munich Central Collecting Point, Oct. 15, 1945 (no. 9312); released to the USFA, April 25, 1946, and returned to Mrs. Oskar Bondy; Elizabeth A (Mrs. Oskar) Bondy (until 1949; sale, Parke-Bernet, New York, March 3, 1949, lot 81, to Rosenberg and Stiebel, New York (in 1949; sold to Martin); Alastair B. Martin, New York (1949-1954; gift to the Princeton University Art Museum).

caption: Circle of Wolf Huber (German, ca. 1485–1553), Anonymous, South German, formerly attributed to Hans Dürer (German, 1490–ca. 1538), The Visitation, ca. 1520. Tempera on wood panel; 19.4 x 15 cm (sight), 35.5 × 31 × 4.5 cm (frame). Gift of Alastair B. Martin, Class of 1938 (y1954-128)
